indications: Indications moderate to severe dementia in Alzheimer’s disease
name: MEMANTINE HYDROCHLORIDE
cautions: Cautions history of convulsions; interactions: Appendix 1 (memantine)
side-effects:
Side-effects constipation; hypertension; dyspnoea; headache,
dizziness, drowsiness; less commonly vomiting, thrombosis,
heart failure, confusion, fatigue, hallucinations, and abnormal gait; very rarely seizures; pancreatitis, psychosis, depression,
and suicidal ideation also reported
doses:
Initially 5 mg once daily, increased in steps of 5 mg
at weekly intervals to max. 20 mg daily
